string.text: Further development of Stechkin pistols, which was conceived as a replacement for the APS based on the OTs-27. A good enough gun, but it never went into production.
The Belgian assault rifle of the Bullpup system. It has a weaver bar for sights and a mount for a grenade launcher under the barrel.
The legendary American rifle in a modern design for a powerful 20th caliber.
A modern version of the American "trench gun" with plastic-replaced wood elements.
Extremely destructive weapons at close range and the fruit of the gloomy genius of criminals. It is heavily controlled and generally causes concern.
A pump-action shotgun with a semi-automatic firing mode. It is comfortable enough and has a small return, but it is expensive.
A very rare experimental specimen with a screw magazine, each such magazine costs like a new weapon.
A promising Russian automatic with balanced automation, which, however, did not get into mass circulation due to the complexity of the design relative to the AK.
A rather rare sample, the "right hand of democracy", this weapon uses a very serious NATO cartridge 7.62 mm and has a good killing power. All sorts of fasteners for optics are completely absent.
The American sniper rifle of the bullpup layout, under the 50th caliber, capable of easily shooting down a helicopter.

He was popularly nicknamed "the death of the chairman" because of the dimensions uncharacteristic for hunting rifles. It is charged with a box magazine of the 20th caliber through a longitudinally sliding shutter.
Single-barrel hunting-sports rifle of Russian production, existing for different calibers. Inexpensive, used mainly to eliminate single targets from afar.
Japanese self-loading rifle with a magazine from the First and Second World Wars. I wonder how she ended up here?
Kalashnikov light machine gun, which has a very similar design and uses enlarged magazines, as well as bipods for convenience.
The single-shot grenade launcher, which has GP-25 in its base, is very compact and collapsible.
A killer and very distinctive German submachine gun, quite light and comfortable, although some question its quality due to the abundance of plastic parts.
A powerful hand-held machine gun that allows you to fire standing up. Later versions have a dovetail bar.
The hero of the Great Patriotic War to this day remains one of the most coveted automatic weapons for beginners. He is no longer suitable for veterans, because he "spits out" his drum too quickly.
A Soviet pistol with a 7.62x25mm lethal cartridge popular at that time. Reliable and beautiful.
A series of convenient and high-quality pistols, popular all over the world, has several firing modes.
A promising pistol with a roomy magazine, under the "Luger" cartridge. The ejection of the sleeves is carried out upwards.
Pistol under special 5.7õ28 mm. Pretty accuracy and power.
Export revolver for the popular "Magnum" cartridge, quite lethal and compact.
The Belgian pistol is under .45 caliber with good stopping action. It is common in the US civilian market, and therefore in local black markets.
A very rare weapon, the undisputed advantage of which is reliability with a rather unusual feed and the store itself.
A heavy militia carbine with a wide range of ammunition, but only two types can be obtained in the Zone.
Pump-action post-perestroika rifle of the legendary TOZ line.
A successful Czechoslovak pistol with good ergonomics. It is used by many countries of the world.
A fairly modern and convenient sample of weapons on the AR platform for a NATO 7.62 mm rifle cartridge.
A British rifle with a longitudinally sliding bolt, which increases its accuracy. It is used by various special services.
Marksman rifle based on the AR-15 for a more powerful caliber.
Model with integrated suppressor for a silence special operations. Very rare gun.
Export Kalashnikov of the hundredth series for the NATO cartridge 5.56mm. You can fold the butt, there is a regular silencer, but there is no attachment for a grenade launcher under the barrel.
One of the first modifications of the Kalashnikov. A rather old sample, and therefore there is no "dovetail" attachment in principle.
Modern hunting shotgun based on AK. It has a convenient box magazine and a semi-automatic firing mode.

Modern hunting and civilian carbines, which are produced by Russia and are used by many stalkers crossing the border of the CAZ. There is no mount for the sight, and it is unlikely because of the design of the weapon.
Further development of the line of special weapons. It can be equipped with a 30-round magazine and a folding handle, and also has a folding stock.
A lightweight disposable grenade launcher often used by the military.
A fast and fairly cheap Russian submachine gun with an inconvenient ejection window.
Stechkin pistol combines lethal power and rate of fire at short range.
Hunting shotgun with two side-by-side barrels. One of the most popular weapons, extreme effectiveness in close combat.

This assault rifle combined with a grenade launcher, which is similar to the AKM series, was specially developed for rapid response units. The main differences are its 9x39 calibre ammunition, bullpup layout, and extensive configuration options. This weapon is highly valued by military stalkers due to its ability to kill enemies wearing body armour behind improvised cover at a distance during urban combat, as well as its excellent stopping power.
A popular American assault rifle that has been in service for decades.

This submachine gun deservedly enjoys great popularity due to its reliability, ease of handling and high accuracy of shooting. Adopted by the army and police units of many countries, it appeared on the black market and eventually reached the Zone.

The most common pistol in the zone, a legacy of the Soviet era, PM is one of the best representatives of the class of compact self-defense weapons. It is small in size, extremely reliable, easy to use and maintain. Among the disadvantages are the short range and accuracy of shooting, low bullet efficiency and - in comparison with modern pistols of the same class - a rather large mass with insufficient magazine capacity. This version of the weapon has a slightly more spacious magazine.

Manual modification of an army machine gun with belt power. Despite the high mass and unsatisfactory accuracy of the battle, he found himself quite widely used in the Zone. It is mainly used to suppress an outnumbered enemy and to clean up mutant lairs.

This revolver-type grenade launcher uses six rifled front-loading barrels, identical to under-barrel launcher attachments. The drum is also front-loading. Widely used for rapid suppression of enemy firing positions and, when in the open, attacking defended fixed targets or fighting particularly tough monsters.

A relatively new assault rifle that has quickly found admirers around the world, despite lacking a 'trendy' design. Weapons of this series are one of the best in their class, renowned for their reliability, accuracy, and ease of use. Despite being relatively difficult to obtain in the Zone, this assault rifle is often ordered by experienced stalkers at considerable expense.

An army sniper rifle that has been on the market for more than fifty years and has earned its reputation for exceptional reliability and ease of use. The SVDm-2 is normally used by the army to improve the effective range of its units, but stalkers respect this weapon for its armour-piercing properties, which allow it to penetrate mutant hide and army body armour.

This extremely common over-and-under hunting shotgun can offer better protection against mutants than a pistol, thanks to its accuracy and stopping power. Used mostly by rookies on the outskirts of the Zone.

Impeccable reliability and durability combined with excellent accuracy are the main noteworthy features of this weapon. Its minor drawbacks include its considerable size, relatively high center of gravity, and massive bolt, which make it difficult to conceal, but do not outweigh the weapon's positive features. The weapon is especially popular with veterans of the Zone.

A special military sniper rifle purpose-built for silent, flashless sniping during special operations where early detection of the shooter may be critical. The Vintar BC provides high armour-piercing capability and stopping power, as well as being equipped with an integrated sniper and optical scope. Highly rated by many stalkers despite its small magazine.

A Western smoothbore shotgun that is extremely popular around the world thanks to its amazing reliability and faster reloading speed. Particularly valued for its functionality by the Zone's hunters. All of its parts are coated with an anti-corrosion compound.
Ordinary pump-action shotgun from Russia, often used for hunting.
A new semi-auto shotgun with not very good reliability.

A modern assault rifle developed as a replacement for the ageing AKM 74/2. The main difference is its high speed 2-round burst firing mode, which allows two bullets to be fired at exactly the same spot on a target up to 100 metres away. This significantly increases the likelihood of hitting the target in comparison to the 1 round firing mode, which considerably improves kill potential, stopping power, and armour piercing capability.

This weapon, designed in 1974, signalled the adoption of small calibre and low impulse rounds by Warsaw Pact countries. A descendant of the most popular assault rifle in the world, the AKM-74/2 has an even bigger muzzle brake, resulting in a reduction of what was already manageable recoil. This facilitates better accuracy and groupings, especially when fired in fast single shots or bursts. As before, the rifle is very simple and reliable.

Despite being similar to submachine guns in size, weight, and tactical purpose, this weapon is classified as an assault rifle due to the fact that its internal mechanism is identical to that of the AKM 74/2. The weapon is notable for its mobility in close quarters and high armour-penetration capacity, while its drawbacks are its short effective range, despite the relatively long bullet range, a tendency to overheat and high ricochet propensity.

An improved version of a classic automatic pistol, which passed all the major armed conflicts of the 20th century with flying colours and entered the new millennium with confidence. Produced by dozens if not hundreds of arms manufacturers around the world in both standard and modified configurations. The weapon's only drawback, its mediocre magazine capacity, is largely compensated by the hard-hitting ammo it uses.

The ultimate hand cannon: bulky, heavy, and highly lethal. Developed as a specialised weapon for hunting medium-sized and large game, as well as for shooting competitions involving firing at steel body targets at distances over 50 metres. Its limited use in the Zone can be attributed to its price, size and weight, which are all double those of other pistols.

A Ukrainian-made pistol predominantly used by law enforcement organisations. Provides higher accuracy, better ergonomics, and a larger magazine capacity than the PMm. These pistols make it into the Zone in large numbers thanks to the sale of defective weapons, which suffer from technical miscalculations in early design models. Despite this, the pistol is in demand among stalkers thanks to its good combat characteristics.
The PFM-1 is an anti-personnel mine with an infamous reputation for being the cause of large amounts of civilian casualties. Often referred to as a 'butterfly' mine due to its unusual shape.

This Soviet legacy is the most common pistol in the Zone and is one of the best compact self-defence handguns available. It is small, highly reliable, easy to use and maintain in working order. It also suffers from several drawbacks, including its short range, low firing accuracy, and poor stopping power, while also losing out to modern pistols in its class in terms of weight and magazine size.

A smoothbore combat revolver-type shotgun intended to provide extreme firepower for militarised units. The weapon benefits from a large magazine and a high effective rate of fire, but its bulkiness and considerable weight, combined with a long reload time, are the price to be paid for these advantages. Rare in the Zone and is used primarily to clear closed spaces of mutants.

This grenade launcher from the 1960s made its way into the Zone from army depots. The weapon is a smoothbore single-shot recoilless launch system with an open-rear tube. Comes with a PGO-7 x2.7 optical scope. Although its huge size and weight make it an unlikely choice for stalkers, it has found admirers in the Zone given its huge destructive power and ease of use.

The only remaining mass produced model of a globally renowned pistol, this weapon has earned a reputation for its excellent ergonomics and accuracy, and while its magazine is relatively small, it benefits from powerful ammo and a mechanism that functions like a Swiss watch. Some believe the SIP-t M200 to be the best mass produced .45 ACP calibre handgun there is, and it has certainly got a following among experienced stalkers and mercenaries.

A modernised version of the SVDm-2 sniper rifle in a compact bullpup design made on the order of rapid response forces. It allows faster precision fire and is considerably lighter, while its single shot firing accuracy at short and medium range is similar to that of its predecessor. These qualities have earned it the admiration of countless stalkers.

A super-accurate hi-tech weapon known as item 62, this rifle was developed in secret laboratories located inside the Zone. The weapon operates by accelerating bullets to extremely high speeds using a system of electromagnets, which provides incredible stopping power with virtually no recoil. The weapon is powered by using encapsulated artefact fragments in the batteries.

Martha pistols enjoy the reputation of a relatively reliable, albeit somewhat cumbersome weapon, around the world. In service with armed forces and police across the ocean, as well as various military and law enforcement organisations worldwide. The pistol is equally popular with members of the underworld, thanks to its powerful round and magazine capacity. Marthas found in the Zone are usually dated, probably from retired stock.

An excellent Western pistol known for its reliability, high capacity magazine, and good accuracy, as well as being among the most ergonomic handguns in its class. One of the most widely used pistols in the Zone, both among professionals and rookies who can afford it.

An optical sight with variable multiplicity, designed to replace the 4x ACOG sight from Trijicon. Equipped with an aperture mechanical sight, which allows you to fire from it at close range without dismantling the sight itself.
Compact collimator holographic sight from the American company of the same name. Waterproof and compatible with HDPE.
Optical sight, which is specially designed for sniper rifles of the SVD type.

The 1PN93-1 night sight is designed to monitor the battlefield and conduct targeted shooting in conditions of natural night illumination at ambient temperatures from plus 50 ° C to minus 50 ° C and relative humidity up to 100% (at a temperature of 25 ° C).

The 1PN93-4 night sight is designed to monitor the battlefield and conduct targeted shooting in conditions of natural night illumination at ambient temperatures from plus 50 ° C to minus 50 ° C and relative humidity up to 100% (at a temperature of 25 ° C).

The Saracen sight is one of the latest developments of the Novosibirsk Instrument-Making Plant, mass-produced since 2011. Its distinctive feature is its low weight (670 gr.) and dimensions. At the same time, the body of the sight is made of metal. The sight is equipped with an EOP of generation 2+ or 3.
Mounted on a picatinny rail, it is a very rare and expensive sight, which provides a good multiplicity of approximation.

The cobra sight provides confident aiming in natural light conditions (bright sunny day, deep twilight and moonlit night) due to the presence of 16 levels of manual brightness adjustment of the sighting mark. The location of the sighting mark and the target in the same plane allows aiming with both one and two eyes, which creates an unlimited field of view for the shooter, and conduct effective high-speed shooting at fast-moving, small-sized and suddenly appearing for a short time targets.
The usual Soviet sight, which was installed on many types of weapons. Now it can only be worn on SKS or a Mosin rifle.
A little-known sight that is attached to a Japanese carbine from the First and Second World Wars.
A slightly more modern sight, but still with the same classic sighting brand "stump". Suitable for the "Groza" gun and some rifles.
Assault sight for automatic rifles of predominantly Western production, has an appropriate aiming multiplicity.
Holographic sight for Western automatic rifles that have the necessary bar for this.
A standard sight with a 4x magnification, used mainly on domestic weapons.
Modern Russian collimator sight. The main feature of the sight is the mounting of the reflector without a mechanical frame that covers a noticeable part of the firing sectors.
An optical sight that is designed specifically for hand-held grenade launchers, taking into account their ballistics and firing features.

An effective sound suppressor which can be modified on the go as required. The body of the suppressor around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal diaphragms with holes for the bullet to pass through. The set includes adaptors and sealants for most weapons. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.
A regular under-barrel grenade launcher for most Soviet weapons.
This under-barrel grenade launcher is designed specifically for the OTs-14 "Groza" and allows you to throw grenades and fire with one trigger mechanism during preliminary mode switching.
American standard-issue grenade launcher. Uses projectiles that shoot off the sleeve, unlike Soviet grenades.
A grenade launcher from Belgium, which is massively used on such weapons as the FN Scar. Apart from convenience and ergonomics , it did not have any special differences from the M203.
A large-caliber cartridge created in the USA for the Browning machine gun. They are usually equipped with antimaterial rifles.
Soviet pistol cartridge of 7.62mm caliber. A simple one-piece bullet with a lead core.
Soviet pistol cartridge of 7.62mm caliber. Bullet with steel core, improved armor piercing.
A powerful cartridge and a running American cartridge designed specifically for police revolvers.
It was created as a replacement for the standard NATO pistol caliber, but it never became a standard.
Designed for the KS-23 shotgun. They are ordinary shrapnel, except that the shell of the sleeve is made of cardboard.
This bullet in a cardboard shell is quite capable of disabling the engine of a truck.
NATO standard rifle ammunition. The caliber is 7.62mm. A simple shell bullet with a lead core.
An old and rare ammunition, which Soviet submachine guns and rifles were once equipped with. At the moment, the weapon that uses it is very unpopular, although it is less susceptible to wear.
The armor-piercing version of the ammunition allows you to hit targets behind some shelters, such as wide wooden boards or brickwork.
Charge for the RPG-26 grenade launcher, effective against vehicles.

The .45 calibre full metal jacket round has enjoyed popularity for more than a hundred years thanks to its heavy bullet and a relatively small propelling charge. As a result, the bullet in this round is relatively slow but highly accurate, and provides considerable stopping power.

This unusual .45 ACP calibre round is comprised of a jacketed soft point bullet with an expanding hollow and a steel core. It is a combination of jacketed expanding soft point and armour-piercing bullets, benefiting from the advantages of both and suffering from their downsides.
Standard 12 gauge 00 buckshot, containing nine pellets. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.
This heavy 12 calibre slug round is normally used for hunting big game, but is also good for other purposes. Instead of piercing, this hefty slug simply crushes through armour.
Military 5.45x39 7H22 calibre armour-piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. The bullet contains a hard-alloy armour-piercing penetrator. Effective against body armour.

Military 5.45x39 7H10 calibre improved piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. Provides better accuracy than the 7.62x39mm round thanks to reduced recoil and a 100 metre increase in range.
The latest NATO military 5.56x45mm enhanced penetration round, known as M855A1, used by the US armed forces. Increased effectiveness against both body armour and soft tissue.

A standard issue NATO 5.56x45 calibre round specially designed for accurate automatic fire. Provides good ballistic characteristics, having been designed on the basis of a hunting round. Widely known under its SS109 index.
A 7.62 calibre sniper round with a steel penetrator specially designed for the SVD. Unlike the machine gun round, the 7H14 provides tight groupings and excellent penetration characteristics.
Cheap 7.62 calibre machine gun round. Its design makes it unsuitable for sniper rifles, so it is used only with the RP-74 machine gun.
A full metal jacket round with a steel penetrator and a lead core under a metal jacket. Provides good stopping power but is ineffective against body armour.

This round contains a bullet with enhanced stopping power, while its European +P+ designation indicates 'overpressure ammunition' with a 30% increase in muzzle velocity. Ineffective against body armour.

This basic 9x19 calibre round with a jacketed bullet has good characteristics while being simple to produce. The round is popular due to the fact that international conventions prohibit the use of expanding ammunition in combat. Ineffective against body armour.

This 9x19 calibre jacketed hollow point bullet with an expanding hollow provides high stopping power and low ricochet propensity. Used by police and for self-defence. Ineffective against body armour due to its low penetration potential.

The SP-6 is a subsonic assault rifle round with a jacketed soft point bullet with a hard steel core that protrudes from the casing. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries. Effective against body armour.

The SP-5 is a subsonic sniper round with a bimetallic casing. The round contains a steel core with a gap behind it that is filled with lead. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries.
40mm grenade for the M203 under-barrel grenade launcher. This round has a five metre kill zone. Also suitable for use in the FT-200M's integrated grenade launcher.

Fragmentation warhead for anti-personnel warfare used with the RPG-7U grenade launcher. The main purpose of the warhead is to kill enemies in cover outside the range of hand grenades using the RPG-7U launcher.

Regular fragmentation grenade for the GP-25 under-barrel grenade launcher. This round has a five metre kill zone. The VOG-25 grenade is also used in the Tunder S14 complex and Bulldog 6 revolver-type grenade launcher.

A defensive hand grenade, with fragments capable of piercing medium level body armour. The grenade has a lethal radius up to 15 metres. Stalkers get F1 grenades from trading with the military, who write them off as having been used for fighting mutants.
A cheap fragmentation grenade with relatively small radius. Often used by stalkers to 'smoke out' mutants due to its low cost.
A hand smoke grenade. Used to put up smoke screens. Once the grenade is thrown it takes 10 seconds for the smoke screen to expand.
Batteries that use an encapsulated fragment of the Flash artefact as their power source. Manufactured using hi-tech equipment.
These lower-capacity cells use encapsulated fragments of the Flash artefact as their power source. Their lower capacity is due to makeshift production conditions and lack of specialised equipment.
A rare, but very high-quality American bayonet knife.
A common Soviet bayonet for Kalashnikov, quite high-quality and functional.
An ordinary knife, which many people drag from the mainland. It is suitable only for opening preserves.
In the Zone, it is quite often possible to find axes both still Soviet and new.
An indispensable friend of any stalker, soldier and treasure hunter. The main thing is that the bayonet is of high quality and does not bend.
You can find it on construction sites or in old garages, as well as with mercenaries.
An indispensable attribute of hacking anything, is popular in the Zone.
